html: The alternating chaos/creation pattern in these chapters illustrates the ambivalence of the Jacob/Israel category of Jehovah’s people. Faced with two choices—one leading to rebirth, re-creation, and deliverance; the other to ruin, de-creation, and destruction—this spiritual category lacks the vision to see, hear, and understand fully what is at stake. Jehovah appeals to them that he—their Maker, who “formed” or created them initially—has chosen them to be his collective servant or vassal. Their proving loyal and living up to the name Jeshurun or “Upright One” will dispel their fears of the unknown.
